content: sherry s crochet headband notes if you ve ever made a granny square this is pretty much just a rectangular one hook size f or to suit yarn you chose yarn about 0 7 ounces or 33 5 yards i used blue moon socks that rock in mediumweight and lightweight for the examples you see here the orange/yellow/black/grey is mediumweight the spring bright is lightweight there isn t any gauge just pick a hook size that makes a stitch you like special stitches double_crochet cluster is 3 double_crochet chain 1 in a chain 1 space pattern start by chain 68 base row double_crochet in 6th chain from hook and in next 2 chain chain 1 skip one chain in starting chain double_crochet in next 3 chain repeat across 16 clusters do not turn round 1 chain 3 2 double_crochet in the space formed by final double_crochet of base row see fig 1 which shows ch3 and 1 double_crochet made in that spot chain 2 3 double_crochet in same space ch1 work a double_crochet cluster in the next chain 1 space & all the way down one side in the chain-5 space at the end of the base row work 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 1 see fig 2 which shows 2 double_crochet made in that spot then work a double_crochet cluster in next chain-1 space and each chain-1 space across 3 double_crochet chain 2 in same space the round began in join to beginning chain 3 with a slip_stitch slip_stitch in next 2 double_crochet and in chain-2 space do not turn fig 1 fig 2 round 2 and round 3 if you want a wide headband mine are just 2 rounds chain 3 2 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 1 work double_crochet cluster in each chain-1 space across and 3 double_crochet chain 2 3 double_crochet chain 1 in each corner see fig 3 for the end of round 2 here i just need to chain-1 and join join as in round 1 do not turn fig 3 finishing off to make that little triangle at each end slip_stitch to get to the chain 2 edge chain 1 and turn single_crochet evenly across 7 sts chain 1 turn decrease 1 single_crochet at each end of the next 2 row as before 5 sts then 3 last row - decrease all 3 at once leaving 1 st then chain 60 for tie end off attach yarn in other edge and do the same end off for a variation as pictured below chain 260 work just the base row then the first row it s skinny enough to tie kind of behind one ear and the ends hang down over your shoulder it looks really cute on
